com.joffrey_bion.utils.stats

Class FlowStats

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.joffrey_bion.utils.stats.FlowStats
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class FlowStats
extends Object
implements Cloneable
    This class provide statistics methods such as mean, standard deviation and variance over a series of values received in a flow. The most interesting thing is that the whole series of values is never stored internally, only sums.

    The way it works is quite simple: the FlowStats object must be fed with double values through the methods add(double) and remove(double) , and then the statistics methods can be called. 

     FlowStats stats = new FlowStats();
 stats.add(1.0);
 stats.add(4.0);
 stats.add(4.0);
 stats.mean(); // returns 3.0
 stats.remove(4.0)
 stats.mean(); // returns 2.5
    Author:
    Joffrey BION

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(double value)
      Adds a value to this series, with a weight of 1.
      void add(double value, double weight)
      Adds a value to this series.
      void clear()
      Resets this FlowStats, as if all values were removed from the series.
      double coeffOfVariation()
      Returns the coefficient of variation of this series of values.
      FlowStats getCopy()
      Returns a copy of this FlowStats object.
      int getNbValues()
      Return the number of values that were put in this series.
      double getTotalWeight()
      Return the total weight of the values that were put in this series.
      double mean()
      Returns the mean of this series of values.
      void remove(double value)
      Removes a value from this series, that was previously added via add(double) (with a weight of 1).
      void remove(double value, double weight)
      Removes a value from this series.
      double standardDeviation()
      Returns the standard deviation of this series of values.
      double variance()
      Returns the variance of this series of values.
